newsitem.title: GERMANY: German barge operators hit by freeze receive aid.
newsitem.headline: German barge operators hit by freeze receive aid.

text.p: German barge operators hit by frozen waterways are to receive up to five million marks in emergency aid, a statement from the barge industry association BDB said on Friday.

It said the transport ministry had agreed that with effect from today, each icebound barge would receive 200 marks a day and damages up to now would be compensated by immediate payments of 3,000 marks.
BDB said the help did not cover all of the losses incurred, but it welcomed the ministry's step which it said came in reponse to BDS lobbying.
BDB said another severe winter after months of lost business in the previous cold period in early 1996 -- the longest since 1963 -- could spell the end for many small barge operators.
Two-thirds of the BDB fleet of some 3,000 vessels was paralysed this week by ice on rivers and canals so barges were unable to collect coal, ore, oil products and other cargoes.
BDB represents the bulk of German-owned inland vessels in the 500-3,500 tonne category.
